Replace.Text: +{1_num}[ICON_Production] production from neighboring {LOC_DISTRICT_SONOGAMI_BATH_NAME}.
Dire Paradise (Utopia)
<Ruler> Garden God Rinne
Hell of Paradise
Misfortune Paradise (Reincarnation)
<Ruler> Garden God Lino
Hell of Paradise
paradise
paradise lost

City +15% [ICON_Food] food. Farms, plantations +1 [ICON_Food] food. +2 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction for cities with granaries. [NEWLINE]Whenever you are not at war with any civs, maintenance costs are reduced. When your military unit dies, all remaining units regain some health and movement. [NEWLINE]When your city is razed or sacked, some of its inhabitants will migrate to neighboring cities. [NEWLINE]When other civilizations recruit [ICON_GreatPerson] greats, you get a random number of corresponding [ICON_GreatPerson] great points.
Garden God Rinne
Garden God Rinne (Pope)
Sonoshin Lino
reality of truth

[ICON_Citizen] Each area of ​​a city with a population of 5 or more gets +1 [ICON_Science] technology value, +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value and +1 [ICON_Gold] gold coins, and the output increases by one when [ICON_Citizen] population reaches 15 and 25 times. [NEWLINE]Industrial areas, commercial centers, and ports provide 10% growth rate for the city; holy places, theater squares, and colleges provide 10% territorial expansion speed for the city; entertainment centers, water parks, and airports provide 10% tourism performance for the city; wonders for Cities provide +1 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction. [NEWLINE]If you are the suzerain of the city-state, the [ICON_Strength] combat strength of the city-state unit will be +7 (including units that have been recruited).
+7 from Reality of Truth
Fiction and reality intertwined

Reality of Truth: [ICON_Citizen] gets +1 [ICON_Science] technology value, +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value and +1 [ICON_Gold] gold coin for each area of ​​a city with a population of 5 or more. [ICON_Citizen] produces 15 and 25 population each doubled. [NEWLINE]Industrial areas, commercial centers, and ports provide 10% growth rate for cities; holy places, theater squares, and colleges provide 10% territorial expansion speed for cities; entertainment centers, water parks, and airports provide cities with 10% tourism performance; wonders for Cities provide +1 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction. [NEWLINE]If you are the suzerain of the city-state, the [ICON_Strength] combat power of the city-state unit will be +7 (including units that have been recruited). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Illusion of Annihilation: The area adjacent to the city center can get the standard adjacency bonus, and the bonus will be doubled when [ICON_Citizen] population reaches 10 and 20 respectively. [NEWLINE]When the second-to-last [ICON_greatperson] of each type is recruited, automatically get the last [ICON_greatperson] of that type if you haven't already. [NEWLINE]Gain a Great Person Token when your [ICON_GreatPerson] runs out of charges. When the [ICON_GreatPerson] great person of another civilization runs out of uses, if the great person has passive ability, you get a copy with only passive ability. [NEWLINE]Other civilizations cannot attack your vassal city-states.
Annihilation

The area adjacent to the city center can get the standard adjacency bonus, and the bonus will be doubled when the population of [ICON_Citizen] reaches 10 and 20 respectively. [NEWLINE]When the second-to-last [ICON_greatperson] of each type is recruited, automatically get the last [ICON_greatperson] of that type if you haven't already. [NEWLINE]Gain a Great Person Token when your [ICON_GreatPerson] runs out of charges. When the [ICON_GreatPerson] great person of another civilization runs out of uses, if the great person has passive ability, you get a copy with only passive ability. [NEWLINE]Other civilizations cannot attack your vassal city-states.
ambassador of peace

Likes civilizations that announce friendly relations. Hate civilizations that attack from behind or declare a raid war. [NEWLINE]Will attempt to create high-level walls around cities, respecting like-minded civilizations. Hate civilizations that don't fortify their cities. [NEWLINE]Want to be safe and unconquered. Dislikes civilizations that conquer other players' original capitals. [NEWLINE]Preferred to create a variety of different regions, and hoped other civs would follow suit. He doesn't like civs that stick to one area type, or that don't create all possible area types. [NEWLINE][ICON_GreatPerson] will be recruited whenever possible. Likes civilizations that don't compete for [ICON_GreatPerson] greats. Hate losing to other civs in the race for the [ICON_GreatPerson] great. [NEWLINE]Likes a civ that liberates cities. Dislikes civilizations that occupy enemy cities in war.
Paradise Defender
Dire Paradise features an ancient anti-cavalry unit that replaces Lancers. [NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if adjacent to at least 1 defender.
phalanx
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one defender nearby.
+{1_Amount} [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when adjacent to another defender
Guardian of Paradise
Dire Paradise features an ancient melee unit that replaces the Warrior. [NEWLINE]+17[ICON_Strength] combat strength when fighting light cavalry and heavy cavalry units.
reload the main army
+17[ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when facing light cavalry and heavy cavalry units.
+{1_Amount} Combat Strength when facing light cavalry and heavy cavalry units
Phantoms of Paradise: Anansi
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE]A demigod and traveler of African folklore, noted for his cunning and cunning.
Phantom of Paradise: Arthur
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE]King and founder of the Knights of the Round Table, noted for his virtue and chivalry.
Phantom of Paradise: Beowulf
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE]A mighty warrior from the far north, renowned for his strength and prowess in single battles.
Phantom of Paradise: Hercules
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE]A demigod of superhuman strength, known for his Twelve Great Deeds.
Phantom of Paradise: Himiko
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE]The witch queen of ancient Japan, famous for her intelligence and magic power.
Phantom of Paradise: Hippolyta
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE]The warrior queen of the Amazons, known for her leadership and martial skills.
Phantoms of Paradise: Huna Heppard and Schubrank
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE]Legendary athlete and hero of the Maya, noted for his ability to manipulate death and the underworld.
Paradise Phantom: Ouya
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE]Represents Orisha, the God of Storm, Thunder and Lightning, famous for her powerful divine power.
Paradise Phantoms: Maui
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE]Demigod and hero of Polynesian mythology noted for his achievements and gifts to humanity.
Paradise Phantom: Mulan
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE]Dedicated and skilled warrior, known for his dedication and [ICON_Loyalty].
Paradise Phantom: Sinbad
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE][COLOR_LIGHTBLUE] sailing hero. [ENDCOLOR] explorer and treasure hunter, known for his eerie and wonderful journeys.
Phantom of Paradise: Monkey King
The characteristic hero unit of Dire Paradise has only passive abilities. [NEWLINE]The Monkey King, a hero in ancient China. Known for his resourcefulness and invulnerability.
deeply motivated
All units within 2 cells have +5 [ICON_Strength] combat power.
+{1_Amount}[ICON_Strength] combat strength from nearby inspired heroes
Favor of Hippolyta
Hippolyta automatically heals {1_Amount} HP every turn.
The resurrection of the twins
Any normal land unit killed by Hunakh and Shubrank will be resurrected and put under your control with full health and movement.
Mulan's dedication
Hua Mulan gains {1_Amount} [ICON_Strength] combat strength every round.
Mulan's Defiance
Mulan will automatically camp at the end of each round.
The Seventy-two Changes of Monkey King
Monkey King is invisible unless adjacent to an enemy unit.
Sun Wukong's Immortal Body
Sun Wukong's lifespan has been greatly increased.
Sinbad's travels
Sinbad will get {1_GoldReward} [ICON_Gold] gold coins after discovering continents or natural wonders.
navigator
Access to ocean cells.
alert
Ignores the [ICON_Movement] movement debuff of Forest and Rainforest terrain features.
Perseverance
Ignores the [ICON_Movement] movement debuff for hilly terrain.
quick
Ignores all terrain's [ICON_Movement] movement debuffs.
diplomatic
Ability to enter foreign lands even when not at war.
Paradise Settlers
Use the [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route to move, when you reach our city, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] increases; when you finish, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] decreases.
Paradise Settlers (1 Population)

Use the [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route to move. When arriving in our city, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] will be +1; when it is completed, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] will be -1.
Paradise Settlers (2 Population)

Use the [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route to move. When arriving in our city, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] will be +2; when it is completed, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] will be -2.
Paradise Settlers (3 Population)
Use the [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route to move, when arriving in our city, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] +3; when completed, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] -3.
Paradise Settlers (4 Population)
Use the [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route to move, when arriving in our city, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] +4; when completed, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] -4.
Paradise settler (population 5)

Use the [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route to move. When arriving in our city, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] will be +5; when it is completed, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] will be -5.
Paradise mover
When the construction is completed, store the city where it is located. When developing a city, restore the stored city
Paradise Baths

The characteristic area of ​​Dirty Paradise. Replaces aqueducts and is cheaper to build. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Bring water from adjacent rivers, lakes, oases, or mountains to provide the city with fresh water. Cities without fresh water resources get up to 6 [ICON_Housing] housing. The city [ICON_Housing] with fresh water resources has +2 housing quantity. If built next to a geothermal fissure, +3 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction. In any case, the baths provide an additional +2 [ICON_Housing] housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction bonus. Avoid [ICON_Food] food loss during drought. Must be built next to the city center. Military Engineers can spend 1 point of use to complete 20% of the bathroom construction progress.
+{1_num}[ICON_Food] food from adjacent areas.
+{1_num}[ICON_Food] Food comes from adjacent rivers.
+{1_num}[ICON_Food] Food comes from adjacent oasis tiles.
+{1_num}[ICON_Food] Food comes from adjacent mountain tiles.
paradise enchantment

The characteristic building of the Paradise of Misfortune, replacing the ancient city wall. [NEWLINE][ICON_Production] has higher production costs and external defenses. Provides additional [ICON_Tourism] tourism deeds as civic progresses. Provides +1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person Points to adjacent Profession Areas. +1 [ICON_Culture] culture per era since construction or last repair. Cannot be upgraded to Medieval Walls.
Paradise Irrigation Canal

The characteristic building of Dire Paradise, which replaces the water mill. [NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Housing] housing and +2 [ICON_Production] production. Freshwater cells get +1 [ICON_Food] food. Cities must be adjacent to rivers.
Paradise Polder
Paradise Marina Polder

A characteristic building of the Paradise of Misfortune. [NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] food, +1 [ICON_Production] production and +1 [ICON_Housing] housing. +1 [ICON_Food] food and +1 [ICON_Culture] culture when adjacent to other polders. Additional [ICON_Production] production, [ICON_Gold] coins, and [ICON_Food] food are available as you progress through the tech and civic trees. Must be built on a coast or lake tile and adjacent to at least 3 passable land tiles. The [ICON_Movement] movement cost of this cell is increased by 2 points. [NEWLINE]Give [ICON_tourism] tourism reward after researching "Flight".
Paradise Expansion Polder

A characteristic building of the Paradise of Misfortune. [NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] food, +1 [ICON_Production] production and +0.5 [ICON_Housing] housing. +1 [ICON_Food] food and +1 [ICON_Culture] culture when adjacent to other polders. Additional [ICON_Production] production, [ICON_Gold] coins, and [ICON_Food] food are available as you progress through the tech and civic trees. Must be built on a coast or lake tile and adjacent to at least 1 passable land tile. The [ICON_Movement] movement cost of this cell is increased to 1 point. [NEWLINE]Give [ICON_tourism] tourism reward after researching "Flight".
Paradise Silt Beach Polder

A characteristic building of the Paradise of Misfortune. [NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] food, +1 [ICON_Production] production and +0.5 [ICON_Housing] housing. +1 [ICON_Food] food and +1 [ICON_Culture] culture when adjacent to other polders. Additional [ICON_Production] production, [ICON_Gold] coins, and [ICON_Food] food are available as you progress through the tech and civic trees. Must be built on a Floodplain or Swamp tile. Can be built on the farm and plantation resource in the corresponding location, and the city can use this resource. The [ICON_Movement] movement cost of this cell is increased by 1 point. [NEWLINE]Give [ICON_tourism] tourism reward after researching "Flight".
Paradise Fantasy (faith value)
Each round can provide [ICON_Faith] items equal to 50% of the city's productivity.
Paradise Fantasy (food)
Each round can provide [ICON_Food] food items equal to 50% of the city's productivity.
Paradise Fantasy (Gold)
Items that can provide [ICON_Gold] gold coins equivalent to 100% of the city's productivity each round.
Paradise Fantasy (Science Value)
Each round can provide [ICON_Science] science value items equal to 50% of the city's productivity.
Paradise Fantasy (cultural value)
Each round can provide [ICON_Culture] culture value items equal to 50% of the city's productivity.

My love asks nothing in return, and my paradise is all false.
It is impossible not to find out the most important things.
〈Utopia〉
〈Samsara〉

She has a docile and lovely personality, she is a typical good wife and mother girl, she is good at cooking and housework, and she likes to take care of Shidou. It is worth mentioning that she is not an ordinary elf, but a powerful collection of spiritual power.
A girl who lives in the "Paradise of Misfortune", looks exactly like the <Ruler>, with long purple-red curly hair. She has an innocent personality and wants everyone to be happy.

Rinne Sonogami has short, bright pink, braided hair. Has light brown pupil color, and has the school badge of Laichan High School on the chest. Rinne is a calm and gentle girl. She is Shidou's childhood sweetheart. Every morning, she goes to Wuhe Shidou's house to wake up Wuhe Shidou and prepare breakfast for him.

Identification name: Dominator; after the appearance of the spiritual outfit, the pupils of the eyes have completely changed, the hair volume has increased dramatically, and there are golden shawls on the shoulders and arms, and most of the face is covered by a veil. On top of the head there is a tiara with a golden emblem in the center; Angel: Paradise of Misfortune, "Correction of world powers until desired results are obtained".
The true identity is the personality generated by the power of part of the evil paradise left after sealing Rinne.
